4. audiolib module¶

an interface to a classical music audio library.

class audiolib.AudioLib(args)¶

external interface to audiolib module

initialize()¶

initialize a new music library of audiofiles

synchronize()¶

synchronize the audiofile’s composer/artist/arrangement tags with the tag database

walker(func, **kwargs)¶

Recursively walks the directories/sub-directories under root and applies specified function to each audio file encountered.

Parameters:func (function) – action to apply to audio files.
class audiolib.LibTagFile(args)¶

super class for LibTagFileAction

args¶

Namespace – command line arguments, forwarded from clamm.

audiolib.commit_to_libfile(tagfile)¶

common entry point for writing values from tag database into an audiofile.

audiolib.is_audio_file(name)¶

readability short-cut for testing whether file contains a known audio file extension as defined in config["file"]["known_types"]

audiolib.pcm2wav(pcm_name, wav_name)¶

utility for calling ffmpeg to convert a pcm file to a wav file

audiolib.wav2flac(wav_name)¶

utility for using ffmpeg to convert a wav file to a flac file

class audiolib.LibTagFileAction(args)¶
audio2preferred_format(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

using ffmpeg, convert arbitrary audio file to a preferred type, flac by default

change_tag_by_name(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

globally change a single tag field, applied to a directory or library.

Examples

$ clamm library -d ~/path/to/album/ action –change_tag_by_name -k ALBUMARTIST -v ‘Richard Egarr’

delete_tag_globber(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

Unlike remove_junk_tags, allows removing as glob of similarly named tags, as in the MUSICBRAINZ_* tags, without cluttering config["library"]["tags"]["junk"] with excessive entries.

get_arrangement_set(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

get set and count of instrumental groupings via sorted arrangements

get_artist_counts(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

count/record artist occurences (to use as ranking)

handle_composer_as_artist(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

test for and handle composer in artist fields.

Background
Many taggers/publishers deal with classical music tags by lumping the composer in with the artist, as in ARTIST=JS Bach; Glenn Gould
playlist(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

playlist filter

prune_artist_tags(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

Conform artist/albumartist tag key names by applying config[‘library’][‘tags’][‘prune_artist’] rules

Example
ALBUMARTIST instead of ALBUM_ARTIST
recently_added(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

generate a recently added playlist by looking at the date of the parent directory.

remove_junk_tags(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

similar to prune_artist_tags, but removes all tags that are in config["library"]["tags"]["junk"]

synchronize_arrangement(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

Find arrangement that is best fit for a given file.

synchronize_artist(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

Verify there is an artist entry in tags.json for each artist found in audiofile. Will not update ARTIST/ALBUMARTIST until arrangement is verified

synchronize_composer(tagfile, **kwargs)¶

Verify there is a corresponding entry in tags.json for the composer found in the audiofile.

If an entry is not found, prompt to add a new composer.
